title: karabiber
author: karabiber
content: Access to crypto will become easier with the spread of Bitcoin and crypto money ATMs in Turkey. It was an incredible source of happiness for me to see a Bitcoin ATM for the first time where i live. It was an ATM located inside a central shopping mall. I hope this initiative which makes me very happy will take its place in all cities and ATM points.I think we will see advanced versions of this ATM which is just a simple purchase and sale for now. The ATM has a language option and you can perform your transaction with your phone number.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: karabiber on March 13, 2023, 05:08:16 PMAccess to crypto will become easier with the spread of Bitcoin and crypto money ATMs in Turkey. It was an incredible source of happiness for me to see a Bitcoin ATM for the first time where i live. It was an ATM located inside a central shopping mall. I hope this initiative which makes me very happy will take its place in all cities and ATM points.It's worth celebrating mate. I have only seen his ATMs online and have never used it them. It's good to hear that Turkey supports the growth of Bitcoin. The spread of Bitcoin ATMs will be swift If more government remove the ban on Bitcoin operations. And the availability of these machine will promote the use of Bitcoin as a currency. Hoping to see mine someday.QuoteI think we will see advanced versions of this ATM which is just a simple purchase and sale for now. The ATM has a language option and you can perform your transaction with your phone number.From picture there are also options for buying and selling of bitcoin. I am also glad to know that this ATMs promotes privacy. One of my greatest attraction to Bitcoin is because it promotes anonymity to a large extent.

comments.author: MeCsc
comments.created_time: March 13, 2023, 06:13:35 PMLast edit: March 13, 2023, 07:01:23 PM by MeCsc
comments.body: Congrats this is good news. Nigeria got their first Bitcoin Atm in 2020 but there have been ban in cryptocurrency activities since 2021 and so I don't think it's still functioning and its really disappointing because this Atm do reduce the rate of scam in buying and selling of Bitcoin and The Kyc verification doesn't require you to place all your personal information as most CEX does but just require a basic information like your phone number

comments.author: tjtonmoy
comments.body: Quote from: MeCsc on March 13, 2023, 06:13:35 PMthis Atm do reduce the rate of scam in buying and selling of Bitcoin I don't know about that, mate. As I have never used one, so I have no experience on it. But as every ATM works in such way that it could be hacked. Don't get me wrong on this, as I think it is a great way to reduce scams instead of P2P buy/sell. But my concern is that, could it be hacked? I have no fear regarding stealing, as they are stored digitally and can't be taken away if anyone tries to. But as every digital asset is moved through the internet, it is quite possible to get hacked. So can you share some knowledge with me in order for me to better understand this concept?

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: tjtonmoy on March 13, 2023, 06:57:13 PMBut my concern is that, could it be hacked? Every system and software that's connected to the web could be hacked, there's always that possibility of being in that scenario. But the developers and companies that produce such ATMs, they've taken measures to their security, and for sure that it won't be easy for the perpetrators to commit such acts. There could be attempts and that's why securities of such systems are continuous in terms of updates to avoid into being potential abuses. As for having a bitcoin ATM nearby, it really brings joy to the enthusiast out there. I wish that I'm also near to one of it in my country, there are two already but I need to allot travel time on it since it's not from a nearby station/mall.

comments.author: moneystery
comments.body: This is good news because by increasing the facility to buy BTC in these public places it will increase people's curiosity to be able to know what BTC is and start adopting it, whether it's as an investment asset or just for their transactions. Moreover, Turkey is a country with a fairly high level of crypto adoption, so these facilities will further increase the number of crypto adopters there.

comments.author: John Abraham
comments.body: Quote from: EFS on March 14, 2023, 03:12:45 AMHow ironic is that Turkish government let these Bitcoin ATM's but prohibit its use in the purchase and sale of goods and services. Their decisions are constantly contradicting each other. You can buy Bitcoin from that mall by using that ATM, but you can't use that Bitcoin to buy anything at the same place.I didn't know that Bitcoin Transaction is not allowed in Turkey. I know another country where Bitcoin and all other crypto are banned. But, When miners import ASICs to mine Bitcoin or other coins. Customs release them because they do not understand what it is. I don't know how they import it. But, they are running their miners. What I believe is, If Bitcoin is Banned in Turkey, The ATM Was built before the ban, and the Turkey government didn't check if there are Bitcoin ATMs. Just like in some cities, casinos are banned. Still, there are some casinos inside some Expensive hotels and Bars. Sometimes they get caught, and the government takes action against them. I believe the shopping mall owner or whoever sets the ATMs will be in trouble if the government finds there is a Bitcoin ATM. Just my assumption.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: karabiber on March 13, 2023, 05:08:16 PMAccess to crypto will become easier with the spread of Bitcoin and crypto money ATMs in Turkey. It was an incredible source of happiness for me to see a Bitcoin ATM for the first time where i live.Do you know if they ask for identification to operate with them? The main attraction of crypto ATMs is usually that they do not ask for identification, at least for transactions below certain limits. The fact that they are starting to appear in shopping centres is good, as you said, because people will start to see it as a normal thing, but the use of these ATMs by people who understand them will depend on whether or not they ask for identification and the fees. Usually the fees are high but they don't ask for KYC, and that suits a lot of people.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Quote from: John Abraham on March 14, 2023, 04:27:37 AMWhat I believe is, If Bitcoin is Banned in Turkey, The ATM Was built before the ban, and the Turkey government didn't check if there are Bitcoin ATMs.That's not the case here. The ATM is new and Bitcoin isn't banned in Türkiye. You can trade Bitcoin legally but you can't use Bitcoin to buy any goods or services. Regulation on this issue was published in 2021.No one would make an attempt to set the ATM in a mall without legal permissions. This regulation blocks many initiatives. Unfortunately the potential in the country isn't used well. There are elections in 2 months, maybe new government look more positively and change these rules and regulations.

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: Yes, I think the manufacturers and distributors of Bitcoin ATMs has mostly focused on first world countries at the start, but they are slowly shifting their focus to smaller countries in Europe and even Africa and South America.  I also share your joy, because the same thing happened to me when I saw our first Bitcoin ATM in my country. Just the fact that you are now part of the bigger Bitcoin family, gives you that warm feeling of comfort.

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Great to see some countries are seemingly taking the correct route regarding crypto ATMs. (and thanks for sharing btw)However I am aware of quite a few EU-based states that slowly but steadily made ATM either completely illegal or have high entry-barriers that prevent tiny companies to try their luck in that area. Hope this will change again in the future - indeed "tiny" things like ATMs can have a very nice impact on adoption in the long run.
